alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 3:40AM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING BETWEEN 1000 AND 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 TO 2 feet. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to an inch. * WHERE...Curry County Coast. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
